critique: This executive order establishes the Office of Consumer Affairs within the Executive Office of the President. It aims to protect consumer interests by ensuring fair practices, access to information, and avenues for complaint resolution. The order promotes government intervention in the marketplace to safeguard consumers, coordinate federal consumer programs, and advise the President on consumer-related matters. It also establishes a Consumer Advisory Council to provide expert advice. The order does not directly address immigration, civil liberties, or federalism. It expands executive power by creating a new office within the Executive Office of the President. It promotes social inclusion by protecting consumers. It leans towards government intervention in the economy to protect consumers. It does not directly address ideological tilt.
